intro: Ophiorrhiza densa, commonly known as the dense-leaf marsh plant, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ophiorrhiza densa plays a vital role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and is often used in traditional medicine.
